title: Spirogyra culture, an autotrophic alga no nitrogen

content.question: A culture of Spirogyra (an autotrophic alga) is maintained in a water solution containing dissolved carbon dioxide and a source of phosphates but lacking nitrogen compounds. A researcher determines the rates of synthesis of several organic compounds found in the Spirogyra before and after several weeks in the water solution. Which of the following graphs best illustrates a likely result of the experiment?

choices.label: All options are bar graphs in quadrant one. Each vertical axis is labeled milligrams per liter per minute from zero to fourteen with tick marks in increments of two. The horizontal axis is labeled organic compounds. Data is shown before and after several weeks in the water solution. The compounds are carbohydrates, proteins, lipids and nucleic acids. Carbohydrates have ten-ten milligrams before and twelve after. Proteins have six milligrams before and after. Lipids have eight milligrams before and nine after. Nucleic acids have four milligrams before and one after.

All options are bar graphs in quadrant one. Each vertical axis is labeled milligrams per liter per minute from zero to fourteen with tick marks in increments of two. The horizontal axis is labeled organic compounds. Data is shown before and after several weeks in the water solution. The compounds are carbohydrates, proteins, lipids and nucleic acids. Carbohydrates have ten milligrams before and ten after. Proteins have six milligrams before and two after. Lipids have eight milligrams before and after. Nucleic acids have four milligrams before and less than two after.

All options are bar graphs in quadrant one. Each vertical axis is labeled milligrams per liter per minute from zero to fourteen with tick marks in increments of two. The horizontal axis is labeled organic compounds. Data is shown before and after several weeks in the water solution. The compounds are carbohydrates, proteins, lipids and nucleic acids.  Carbohydrates have ten milligrams before and twelve after. Proteins have six milligrams before and after. Lipids have eight milligrams before and nine after. Nucleic acids have four milligrams before and six after.

All options are bar graphs in quadrant one. Each vertical axis is labeled milligrams per liter per minute from zero to fourteen with tick marks in increments of two. The horizontal axis is labeled organic compounds. Data is shown before and after several weeks in the water solution. The compounds are carbohydrates, proteins, lipids and nucleic acids.  Carbohydrates have ten milligrams before and five after. Proteins have six milligrams before and eleven after. Lipids have  milligrams before and after. Nucleic acids have four milligrams before and less than two after.

content.answer: All options are bar graphs in quadrant one. Each vertical axis is labeled milligrams per liter per minute from zero to fourteen with tick marks in increments of two. The horizontal axis is labeled organic compounds. Data is shown before and after several weeks in the water solution. The compounds are carbohydrates, proteins, lipids and nucleic acids. Carbohydrates have ten milligrams before and ten after. Proteins have six milligrams before and two after. Lipids have eight milligrams before and after. Nucleic acids have four milligrams before and less than two after.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
